glsa.title: Kommander: Insecure remote script execution
glsa.synopsis: Kommander executes remote scripts without confirmation, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: KDE is a feature-rich graphical desktop environment for Linux and Unix-like Operating Systems. Kommander is a visual dialog editor and interpreter for KDE applications, part of the kdewebdev package.

description.p: Kommander executes data files from possibly untrusted locations without user confirmation.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Kommander.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All kdewebdev users should upgrade to the latest version:

references.uri: KDE Security Advisory: Kommander untrusted code execution
